meta.metaTitle: Free Domain Redirect Service - 5 Domains Free, No Credit Card
meta.metaDescription: Redirect up to 5 domains for free with no credit card. Automatic HTTPS, path-based redirects, frame redirects, and 100k requests/month included. Live in under 60 seconds.

hero.headline: Free Domain Redirect Service — Live in 60 Seconds
hero.subheadline: Point any domain to any URL with automatic HTTPS included. No server, no code, no credit card required.

children.text: Why Your Registrar's Forwarding Isn't Enough

Most registrar forwarding is HTTP-only. The moment a visitor types 'https://' or clicks a secure link, the browser shows a 'Connection Not Private' warning—blocking up to 40% of your traffic. RedirHub automatically provisions SSL certificates for every domain you add, so your redirects work securely over both HTTP and HTTPS without any setup.
Free Plan — $0/month, No Credit Card
5 source domains — redirect up to 5 of your own custom domains
100,000 requests/month included
Full HTTPS/SSL — automatic certificate provisioning for every domain
301, 302, and 307 redirect types supported
Path-based redirects — forward specific paths to different destinations
Frame redirects — display destination content inside your domain
Real-time analytics: clicks, geography, referrers, and device types
Who Uses the Free Redirect Service
Personal websites and portfolio pages
Side projects and indie apps pointing a custom domain at a hosted service
Old domains you want to redirect to a new website
Small businesses consolidating multiple domains into one site
Freelancers managing a handful of client or personal domains
Simpler Than Your Registrar, More Reliable Than DIY

Registrar forwarding breaks on HTTPS. Setting up Nginx yourself means managing server maintenance, SSL renewals, and config files. RedirHub handles all of that automatically. Point your domain, set your destination, and you're done—no terminal, no certificates, no ongoing maintenance.
Moving an old domain to a new website and want to protect your search rankings? Use a 301 redirect to preserve link equity during the move. Learn more in our
301 redirect service guide
Want more redirects, more source domains, or team collaboration?
See all plans on the pricing page
. Plans start at $10/month. The free plan includes 1 team member — upgrade anytime without losing your existing redirects.
Create your free account
— no server, no credit card, live in 60 seconds.

faqs.question: What's included in the free plan?
faqs.answer: The free plan is $0/month with no credit card required. It includes 5 source domains, 100,000 requests/month, full HTTPS/SSL, path-based redirects, frame redirects, 301/302/307 redirect types, and real-time analytics. It supports 1 team member, making it ideal for personal projects and solo use.

faqs.question: Why does my redirected domain show a 'Not Secure' warning?
faqs.answer: Registrar forwarding is typically HTTP-only. When a visitor types 'https://' or follows a secure link, the browser shows a 'Connection Not Private' warning instead of completing the redirect. RedirHub automatically provisions SSL certificates for every domain you add, eliminating these warnings without any manual configuration.

faqs.question: Do I need to transfer my domain to RedirHub?
faqs.answer: No. Keep your domain at your current registrar. Just point your domain's DNS—via CNAME or nameservers—to RedirHub. Setup takes under 60 seconds, and SSL certificates provision automatically within the first hour. No domain transfer, no downtime.

faqs.question: Can I redirect my old domain to my new website?
faqs.answer: Yes. Add your old domain to RedirHub, point its DNS to us, and set your new site as the destination. Visitors and search engines landing on the old domain will be forwarded automatically—with HTTPS working on both ends and link equity preserved if you use a 301 redirect.

faqs.question: What is a path-based redirect?
faqs.answer: A path-based redirect lets you forward specific paths on your domain to different destinations. For example, yourdomain.com/blog can redirect to a separate blog platform while yourdomain.com redirects to your main site. The free plan includes path-based redirects across all 5 of your source domains.

faqs.question: Can I change where my domain redirects to later?
faqs.answer: Yes. Update your redirect destination anytime from the dashboard—changes go live in seconds across the global network. No DNS changes, no redeployment, no downtime. This is useful when you move your site, rebrand, or switch hosting providers.

faqs.question: Want more redirects than the free plan allows?
faqs.answer: The free plan covers 100,000 requests/month across 5 source domains. If you need more redirects, more domains, API access, or team collaboration, paid plans start at $10/month. All your existing redirects carry over automatically when you upgrade. See the full breakdown at redirhub.com/pricing.
